cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 300 mi southwest of the mouth of the Mississippi River and 310 mi east of the mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to slow, turn westward, then move northwest toward the middle Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: mid-Texas coast near Matagorda/Port O’Connor area (just northeast of Corpus Christi)
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: Not expected to move back offshore within the 5-day forecast period

weather_observation.under_watch: Hurricane Watch and Storm Surge Watch
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Port Aransas TX to High Island TX; Storm Surge Watch from Port Mansfield TX to High Island TX including all adjacent bays (Baffin, Corpus Christi, Copano, Aransas, San Antonio, Matagorda and Galveston Bays)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Texas coast from Port Mansfield to High Island and adjacent bays, with greatest impact expected along the middle Texas coast near Matagorda and San Antonio Bays
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (2-4 ft forecast in San Antonio Bay)
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (72%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; 37% chance of 50-kt winds at the port, beginning late Sunday and peaking Monday–Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm Surge Watch in effect; 2–4 ft inundation possible in San Antonio Bay and Calhoun County shoreline if peak surge coincides with high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Prolonged heavy rain bands expected Sunday through mid-week with potential for >4 inches and localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along the entrance channel; minor coastal flooding and possible port access restrictions due to rough seas
